body: I got banned from the "BLEEP" network, falsely, for hacking (anti kb, aimbot). I have appealed and been denied because the staff don't believe me when I tell them I don't hack (fuk me). What should I do. I'm not good at this stuff :c
body_tagged: I got banned from the "BLEEP" network, falsely, for hacking (anti kb, aimbot). I have appealed and been denied because the staff don't believe me when I tell them I don't hack (fuk me). What should I do. I'm not good at this stuff :c
title: Banned from the "BLEEP" network.

reply_to.body_tagged: I did. They didn't give me it. Can I say the server's name? xD

replies.body: The server was Overcast...
replies.body_tagged: The server was Overcast...

replies.body:
If this was Avicus then if no proof is provided, you will be unbanned.

But on Overcast, they don't need their Moderators to have proof. They just base it off memory.
It's a terrible system for appeals...but that's their way of doing things.

Unfortunately, if you can't comprehensively prove that you didn't hack, your chances are low.
replies.body_tagged:
If this was Avicus then if no proof is provided, you will be unbanned.

But on Overcast, they don't need their Moderators to have proof. They just base it off memory.
It's a terrible system for appeals...but that's their way of doing things.

Unfortunately, if you can't comprehensively prove that you didn't hack, your chances are low.

replies.body:
Overcast staff cannot just ban you off of a whim or weak (in-game) evidence. The staff don't have all day to sit there staring at you debating whether or not you are using hacks - if you were banned for specific hacks such as aimbot and anti-kb it must have been very obvious you were using them.

Also anti-kb is very obvious. I doubt you were not hacking

But if you truly weren't hacking you have to show them somehow you weren't hacking, which I don't know how would ever be possible. .. but some people have been unbanned by 'showing' moderators sufficient evidence so there has to be some way
replies.body_tagged:
Overcast staff cannot just ban you off of a whim or weak (in-game) evidence. The staff don't have all day to sit there staring at you debating whether or not you are using hacks - if you were banned for specific hacks such as aimbot and anti-kb it must have been very obvious you were using them.

Also anti-kb is very obvious. I doubt you were not hacking

But if you truly weren't hacking you have to show them somehow you weren't hacking, which I don't know how would ever be possible. .. but some people have been unbanned by 'showing' moderators sufficient evidence so there has to be some way

replies.body: They do have time to press a key bind  and record for 30 seconds. Anyways, my Internet was derping at the time and my ping was bad af, maybe that's why they thought I was using anti kb? I wasn't using aimbot either, idek where they got that...

replies.body:
I'm pretty sure even if you have terrible ping your kb will just be delayed. Overcast mods know this, pretty sure they have been playing long enough to tell the difference between delayed kb because of bad connection and anti-kb.

Correct me if I'm wrong though
